comment.author: 77788549@N05
comment._content: www.delvillewood.com/8th Black Watch.htm On 18th July 1916, 8th Battalion Black Watch was subjected to a ferocious German counter attack into the recently (14th/15th July) captured village of Longueval. David Tindal was Commissioned into a Service Battalion (8th?) of the Black Watch (Royal Highlanders) on transfer from a Reserve Battalion (11th?) as a Temporary Second Lieutenant on 15th July 1915 - Published in the London Gazette of 5 August 1916. His appointment to 11th Battalion Black Watch however is published in the London Gazette of 29th July 1915, effective from 30th July 1915. He joined the 11th Battalion, recruited in and around Perth and based at Tain on the East Coast, north of Inverness, with 6 other Second Lieutenants. 8th Battalion Black Watch also recruited in Perth, went out to France in March 1915. David Tindal would therefore have joined them as a replacement platoon commander at the front. The Battalion was in 26th Brigade in 9th(Scottish) Division.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: Son of James Archibald Love Tindal and Maggie Tindal (nee Strang), of 42, Newlands Rd., Newlands, Glasgow. www.cwgc.org
